data.title: Add support for deploy on attack

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
At least TS Nod Artillery and FS GDI Juggernaut need this.

Vehicles that required to be deployed to shoot would move towards target until within weapon range, then deploy and attack.

data.title: Add support for undeploy on move order

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: All TS deployers need this to match original behavior. Might be wanted for RA/TD/D2k MCVs, too.

data.title: Misc yaml style fixes (all mods)
data.body:
Fixes a wrong space on D2k default rocket and a bunch of missing/excess newlines, another redundant space and Visibility order on 2 RA maps.

Prevents these things from popping up when running upgrade rules.

data.title: "Watch Briefing" button not available for 03a and 03b: Dead End
data.body:
In Red Alert, the "Watch Briefing" button is not available for 03a and 03b: Dead End. 

![dead end mission select](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6200170/24532720/254b9e06-1588-11e7-9012-d5159d25db48.png)

Every other mission (aside from Aftermath/Counterstrike missions) has a "Watch Briefing" button in the bottom left corner of the window. These two are missing it.

data.title: oramap file save prevented when open in another program, no warning or prevention
data.body:
Me and someone else noticed this on windows at least where if you have the oramap file open in something else like say 7zip while humming away in the game's map editor all your changes aren't saved.

If there is code to catch this it doesn't seem to be triggering.

data.title: Missing Interior Corner Tile
data.body:
I decided to try my hand at making an interior skirmish map and discovered there's a missing corner tile.
To better assist in finding the missing tile, I provided a screenshot from the mission, Mousetrap, from Aftermath.

![missing interior tile](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/24485086/020f6836-14d0-11e7-8654-aeeb7871ba5b.png)

CORRECTION: Apparently the missing tile is labelled as a "floor" tile.

data.title: Render Glitch Fullscreen Windows 8
data.body:
Using the latest playtest 20170304, OpenRA is unplayable in fullscreen on Windows due to graphical glitches.

However, in Windowed mode, it works perfectly.

Note that the UI works perfectly in both Fullscreen and Windowed mode. It is only the map that is glitching. Also note that the map glitches the same way in game as seen in the images below of the start screen.

Here are the steps to reproduce the problem:

- Launch OpenRA on Windows 8. (Assumes data files have been installed)
- If OpenRA is in Fullscreen mode, there will be graphical glitches
- If OpenRA is in Legacy Fullscreen mode, there will be graphical glitches
- If OpenRA is in Windowed mode, it will run perfectly

Here are some images. (Sorry for the poor quality. I didn't know how to screenshot them.)

![img_20170330_082503144](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2499066/24481518/85d86bd4-1536-11e7-9240-c864c4044952.jpg)

![img_20170330_082525175](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2499066/24481560/c5e5098a-1536-11e7-9f5d-3b1dcb55765f.jpg)

data.title: Add a windows version of the launch-game script.
data.body: The windows counterpart to #12992.

data.title: Crash System.InvalidOperationException when clicking on map after harvester attacked
data.body:
Hello, Im new one, played this game - Dune 2000 Mod at Version playtest-20170304 - for the first time and after a while I got a crash with this log :
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (harvester 108 (not in world))
more in file attachment 

[exception-2017-03-29T192601Z.txt](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/880195/exception-2017-03-29T192601Z.txt)
[debug.txt](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/880198/debug.txt)

data.title: Fixed vision for aircraft husks under Gap
data.body: Fixes #13028

data.title: D2K Game Music is available for download from GruntMods edition, but requires disc
data.body:
On the Manage Content screen for Dune 2000, "Game Music" is listed as being available for download from the GruntMods edition of the game, but it's not possible to actually download it because it's also marked as "Requires Disc".

![dune 2000 game music](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6200170/24433695/fa5a2670-13ef-11e7-86e4-d51e5f4e2ee4.png)

I'm not sure which is correct, but this should be consistent. If it's available to download, the player should be able to click a button to download it, just as they do with the "Base Game Files". If it's not available for download, the GruntMods edition label should be removed from the hover text.

data.title: Feature to allow you to change game settings within a game
data.body:
I have had this happened many times where I get together with my brothers to play some Command and Conquer Tiberium Dawn online then I forget to set the game speed to be fastest instead of normal, resulting in us needing to leave the game and change the settings all over again.

Would it be possible to add settings such as game speed within the in game menu?

data.title: The vision for aircraft husks is unaffected by Gap generated shroud.
data.body:
The aircraft husks need two RevealsShroud traits just like their actor to behave properly under the Gap Generated shroud.
Also the MiG & Yak husks have outdated vision ranges, they need +1.


This is an easy fix:

OpenRA\mods\ra\rules\husks.yaml
TRAN.Husk:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 10c0
++Type: GroundPosition
++RevealGeneratedShroud: False
+RevealsShroud@GAPGEN:
++Range: 8c0
++Type: GroundPosition
			
MIG.Husk:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 13c0
++Type: GroundPosition
++RevealGeneratedShroud: False
+RevealsShroud@GAPGEN:
++Range: 11c0
++Type: GroundPosition
	
YAK.Husk:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 11c0
++Type: GroundPosition
++RevealGeneratedShroud: False
+RevealsShroud@GAPGEN:
++Range: 9c0
++Type: GroundPosition
	
HELI.Husk:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 12c0
++Type: GroundPosition
++RevealGeneratedShroud: False
+RevealsShroud@GAPGEN:
++Range: 10c0
++Type: GroundPosition
	
HIND.Husk:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 10c0
++Type: GroundPosition
++RevealGeneratedShroud: False
+RevealsShroud@GAPGEN:
++Range: 8c0
++Type: GroundPosition

data.title: Make terrain rendering more flexible in terms of cell dependency
data.body:
Creating terrain is among the most time-consuming tasks for any larger modding project. For mods using isometric perspective in particular, being forced to cut a template into dozens of cell-sized image tiles can be a royal pain.

It would be far easier if it was possible to have templates spanning several cells, but have only a single template 'texture' that can then be freely positioned along the X, Y and maybe even Z axis via offsets.

data.title: [TS]GDI & NOD Advanced PowerPlant at the different tech level.
data.body: in bleed branch (download 2017-03-26)NOD Advanced PowerPlant require NOD Vehicle Production, but GDI PowerTurbine Just need GDI PowerPlant.

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
* Closes #10790.
* Makes our PBOG line-build rendering more closely match TS.
* Fixes the powerdown indicator being rendered too low on all actors.
* `WithMakeAnimation` conditions gives us the plumbing for future PRs to kill all the `INotifyBuildComplete` hacks.

data.body:
Statistics window restyled, each tab has hotkey configurable in Settings dialog. Scrollbar added when there is more than 8 players. F1 - show/hide Statistics (previous shown tab is displayed).
In TD there is added number of currently produced items in Production tab. After these changes, more UI improvements can be done simpler.

data.title: Update the official cnc/TD map pool
data.body:
This is a suggested change to the CnC/TD official map pool, arrived at in consultation with many of the regular TD players. This pull request is in response to the request made by pchote here: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=20031, which has discussion and a poll on the issue. I had raised an issue (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/13016) but thought it would be more helpful to make the changes myself.

Below is a list of maps I suggest to add/modify/leave unchanged/remove, comparing with the maps in the playtest-20170304. In the case of maps to be added or modified, I have used 'my' filenames. In the case of maps to be removed, I have used the playtest-20170304 filenames. I have given brief reasons for each modification.

I changed the 'Categories' from '%' to 'Conquest' for the affected maps (all by Norman). I cleaned up the titles of some maps, but I left the map filenames and the map authors intact. As such, the UIDs for ~19 maps will now differ from the list below.


**Add**

1. 169.oramap da8e7c4d4c4ca62812af156769ee9544f403bdd0 http://resource.openra.net/maps/16886/
2. arcade.oramap aeeb0337abf307755a862ee3e321e804e623fdc4 http://resource.openra.net/maps/16895/

data.title: Activities break on intercepting and killing enemy when they are expected to continue
data.body:
Several actor commands that is expected to continue are interrupted and the activity assumed complete when the interruption is resolved. This results in significantly different behaviour from their counterparts on the original games.

Hunt() - Breaks after killing one enemy (Expected: continue Hunt)
AttackMove() - Breaks after killing one enemy (Expected: continue AttackMove until waypoint is reached)
Guard() - Breaks after killing one enemy (Expected: continue Guard)

By 'break', I mean the action is deemed complete and the actors moves on to the next activity.

Patrol() and PatrolUntil() are also affected since they are based on a AttackMove()-Wait() loop. Actors will go to the next waypoint, skipping his/her current waypoint if an enemy is intercepted.

-----------------------------------

**To reproduce:**

Give an actor a _single_ command using an Lua script. Then throw an enemy in its path.

Hunt():
 Actor will hunt for one actor and attack it. Then it will become Idle.

AttackMove():
 Actor will move towards the target location and attack the first enemy it sees. Then it will become Idle.

Guard():
 Actor will move towards the target actor and attack the first enemy it sees. Then it will become Idle.

-----------------------------------

This forces scripters to create their own custom scripts to ensure such activity 'resumes'. This is seen in current campaigns and Lua customised maps across all mods. 

**Case example:**
If you have noticed, almost every mission in the RA mod defines their own IdleHunt and PatrolLoop Lua functions. As they heavily rely on OnIdle script triggers, I expect aircrafts to handle this badly. #13015

-----------------------------------

There exists the possibly of scripters viewing the interruptions as features.

As a solution exists by re-creating the logic on Lua, I would like some word from the devs if the current implementation should be the maintained.

Edit: Engrish.
Edit 2: Clarity.

data.title: Aircrafts has "Attack" property, but does not respond when it attempts to execute Attack(target)
data.body:
Aircrafts (as defined without custom rules) have unusual handling of certain Actor commands exposed by the API. I suspect this to be due to the different traits defined in the aircrafts that the Lua API is unable to handle.

Here I will list out some of the actor commands I have tested and their results.

- [ ] Attack()  Attack planes ignore such commands.
- [X] AttackMove()  No problems identified with both attack planes and helicopters
- [X] Guard()  No problems identified with both attack planes and helicopters
- [x] Hunt()  Game crash for both attack planes and helicopters. See #13014.
- [X] Move()  No problems identified with both attack planes and helicopters.
- [ ] Patrol / PatrolUntil()  Untested.

**To reproduce:**
Use Lua to issue the above commands on an Aircraft

data.title: Replacing the official TD map pool
data.body:
**Update**: I have now made a pull request: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13019

This is a suggested change to the CnC/TD official map pool, arrived at in consultation with many of the regular TD players. This ticket is in response to the request made by pchote here: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=20031, which has a discussion and a poll on the issue. 

I have made a list of maps I suggest to add/modify/leave unchanged/remove, as compared with the maps in playtest-20170304. In the case of maps to be added or modified, I have used 'my' filenames. In the case of maps to be removed, I have used the playtest-20170304 filenames. I have given brief reasons for each modification.

A few maps by Norman have been categorised as type '%' instead of 'Conquest'. They should probably be changed. 

I attach .zip and .tar.gz archives of all the maps (70 maps in total):
[TDmaps-v6.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/867375/TDmaps-v6.zip)

data.title: Suggestion: Allow idle checks for actors that defaults their CurrentActivity to some Activity instead of null
data.body:
**Issue:** 
Aircraft actors that default their CurrentActivity to FlyCircle instead of null will never pass any IsIdle() checks.
This also means that aircrafts cannot normally fire any OnIdle script trigger.

Units tested to be affected: "yak", "mig" (RA)
Suspected affected units as well (but not tested): Ora Bomber (TS)

**To Reproduce:**
Just try making an affected aircraft fire any Trigger.OnIdle function without using Stop(). You can use the full Lua arsenal for your attempt.

**Suggestion:**
Either
 - Allow IsIdle() actor checks to return true if CurrentActivity is the FlyCircle type, or
 - Allow Lua exposure of parts of the Activity class so that actor.CurrentActivity can be queried directly. That function can then be used in place of IsIdle().

data.title: Aircrafts has "Hunt" property, but crashes the game when it attempts to execute Hunt()
data.body:
Aircrafts will **pass the check** on the "Hunt" property, but will **crash the game** when attempting to perform Hunt, likely due to it not having Mobile trait (instead using Aircraft trait to move).

**To reproduce:**

Pass any aircraft ("yak", "mig", "hind", "heli" tested in RA) through this Lua script
```
    if unit.HasProperty("Hunt") then
      unit.Hunt()
    end
```

You will see this crash.

`Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Actor does not have trait of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Mobile`
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.TraitContainer`1.Get(UInt32 actor) in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:line 151
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.Get[T](Actor actor) in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:line 89
   at OpenRA.Actor.Trait[T]() in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:line 243
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.Move..ctor(Actor self, CPos destination, WDist nearEnough)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.Hunt.Tick(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.Activities.Activity.TickOuter(Actor self) in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Activities\Activity.cs:line 174
   at OpenRA.Traits.ActivityUtils.RunActivity(Actor self, Activity act) in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Traits\ActivityUtils.cs:line 37
   at OpenRA.Actor.Tick() in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:line 163
   at OpenRA.World.Tick() in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:line 342
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 587
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 611
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 738
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 778
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 133
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in d:\OpenRA-bleed\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 40`

**Possible solutions:**
Either 
- Make the aircraft fail the HasProperty check, or 
- Allow the aircraft to use its Aircraft trait to execute a Hunt() action.

data.title: Condition support for AmmoPool Trait
data.body:
Have been playing around with units that gain or change weapons via upgrades but ran into Problems with this.

For example if you have a unit with two Armament both with it's own AmmoPool but the secondary Armament is disabled, the unit will not return to reload (because it still has Ammo in the inactive pool).

Also it would be nice if you could hide the Pips as long as an Armament is disabled. 

In addition:
Maybe even allow conditions instead of boolean values for things like _SelfReloads_ or _ResetOnFire_

data.title: Rocket Soldiers not doing damage to Hinds when directly above them.
data.body:
Noticed this while specing a game. I tried to provide a few screen caps as I don't have a video capture.
